Section 6 of the proposed US law allows the Secretary, in consultation with the Director of National Intelligence, to designate a foreign government or regime as a foreign adversary if they find that the government or regime is engaged in a long-term pattern or serious instances of conduct significantly adverse to the national security of the United States or security and safety of US persons. The section also outlines the process for a joint resolution of disapproval of such designation or removal of designation of a foreign adversary.

Section 8 provides the Secretary with the authority to establish rules, regulations, and procedures as they consider necessary to implement the Act. The Secretary may also request information from any party to a transaction or holding under review or investigation, and Section 10 outlines the enforcement mechanisms of the Act.
